pages.title: Step #5: Casting Metals
pages.text: $(item)Casting$() is the act of pouring out either molten $(item)Gold$() or $(item)Aluminum Brass$() over an item to create a mold of that item.$(br2)For example if we poured $(item)Molten Gold$() over a $(item)Seared Brick$() we would get a brick shaped mold that's also capable of casting $(item)Ingots$().

pages.title: Alloying
pages.text: You can $(item)Alloy$() two $(item)Molten Metals$() into a different$(br)$(item)Molten Metal$().$(br2)To make $(item)Molten Aluminum Brass$() you have to mix $(item)Molten Copper$() with $(item)Molten Aluminum$().$(br2)If you've been a good test subject and sifted $(item)Dust$() you should have some $(item)Aluminum$().
In the next step you will need to make $(item)Plates$(), you can make a $(item)Plate Cast$() by pouring $(item)Molten Aluminum Brass$() over a$(br)$(item)Cracked Seared Plate$().
